Package org.apache.spark.util.collection.unsafe.sort

Class UnsafeExternalSorter

java.lang.Object
org.apache.spark.memory.MemoryConsumer
org.apache.spark.util.collection.unsafe.sort.UnsafeExternalSorter
public final class UnsafeExternalSorter extends MemoryConsumer
External sorter based on UnsafeInMemorySorter.

    • closeCurrentPage

      public void closeCurrentPage()
      Marks the current page as no-more-space-available, and as a result, either allocate a new page or spill when we see the next record.

    • spill

      public long spill(long size, MemoryConsumer trigger) throws IOException
      Sort and spill the current records in response to memory pressure.
      Specified by:
      spill in class MemoryConsumer
      Parameters:
      size - the amount of memory should be released
      trigger - the MemoryConsumer that trigger this spilling
      Returns:
      the amount of released memory in bytes
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getPeakMemoryUsedBytes

      public long getPeakMemoryUsedBytes()
      Return the peak memory used so far, in bytes.

    • getSortTimeNanos

      public long getSortTimeNanos()
      Returns:
      the total amount of time spent sorting data (in-memory only).

    • getSpillSize

      public long getSpillSize()
      Return the total number of bytes that has been spilled into disk so far.

      public void cleanupResources()

    • insertKVRecord

      public void insertKVRecord(Object keyBase, long keyOffset, int keyLen, Object valueBase, long valueOffset, int valueLen, long prefix, boolean prefixIsNull) throws IOException
      Write a key-value record to the sorter. The key and value will be put together in-memory, using the following format: record length (4 bytes), key length (4 bytes), key data, value data record length = key length + value length + 4
      Throws:
      IOException

    • merge

      public void merge(UnsafeExternalSorter other) throws IOException
      Merges another UnsafeExternalSorters into this one, the other one will be emptied.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getSortedIterator

      public UnsafeSorterIterator getSortedIterator() throws IOException
      Returns a sorted iterator. It is the caller's responsibility to call `cleanupResources()` after consuming this iterator.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getIterator

      public UnsafeSorterIterator getIterator(int startIndex) throws IOException
      Returns an iterator starts from startIndex, which will return the rows in the order as inserted. It is the caller's responsibility to call `cleanupResources()` after consuming this iterator. TODO: support forced spilling
      Throws:
      IOException
